feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 6:01PM AKST until December 14 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Visibility one half mile at times. * WHERE...In Passes of the Central Brooks Range.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Brooks Range

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 5:09PM AKST until December 15 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THURSDAY TO 9 AM AKST FRIDAY FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Northeast winds gusting as high as 40 mph will reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta Coast, including Mekoryuk.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 5:09PM AKST until December 15 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THURSDAY TO 9 AM AKST FRIDAY FOR THE WESTERN CAPES... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Northeast winds gusting as high as 40 mph will reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Western Capes, including Platinum and Goodnews Bay.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bristol Bay

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 3:02PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORM FORCE FRONT MOVES IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY NIGHT... The second in a series of strong fronts moves over the AK Gulf then into the Panhandle Wednesday evening into Thursday night. While this fast moving system will bring in periods of heavy precipitation and strong winds it is not expected to be as severe
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 13 at 3:00PM AKST until December 14 at 11:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE HAINES AND KLONDIKE HIGHWAYS WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT... .A wave of moisture moving through the northern panhandle will bring moderate to heavy snow for the Haines and Klondike Highways. A period of snow near sea level for Haines and Skagway begins late Wednesday night and lasting through Thursday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 7:41AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SHOWERS LIKELY OVER ANCHORAGE TODAY... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers are likely over Anchorage this morning and then again this evening. Snowfall rates in heavier snow showers could reach one to two inches per hour at times, leading to significantly reduced visibilities. Additional
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage

entry.title: Flood Statement issued December 13 at 2:34PM SST by NWS

entry.summary: .Light freezing rain is occurring in the area west of Highway 83 and south of Interstate 70 in northwest Kansas and eastern Colorado. Ice accumulations will generally be limited to elevated surfaces due to warm ground and road temperatures and be less than a tenth of an inch. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 6:36PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Ice Hidden Under Fresh Snow... Freshly fallen snow from earlier today through this evening will cover and hide dangerous icy patches on walkways and driveways. Any wet or slushy surfaces left untreated overnight may refreeze as temperatures remain below freezing. Be aware of the location of your icy patches and use caution when traveling.
